turn.2: Polenaktion The term Polenaktion ("Polish Action") refers to the arrests and expulsion of approximately 17,000 Polish Jews living within the German Reich in October 1938.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: These deportations, ordered by SS officer and head of the Gestapo Reinhard Heydrich, displaced thousands of Polish Jews along the Germany-Poland border.
turn.5: Why were they ordered to do this?
turn.6: From 1935-1938, Jews living within Germany had most of their rights stripped off by the Nuremberg Laws, and faced intense persecution from the state.

turn.8: As a result, many Jewish refugees sought rapidly to emigrate out of the Reich.

turn.10: However, most countries, still feeling the effects of a global depression, enacted strict immigration laws and simply would not address the refugee problem.
